intro: Anemonospermos pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf anemonosperma, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anemonaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow petals that resemble those of a buttercup. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
